thread.title: Service restored to company hit by Medicaid payment processing hack
thread.title_full: Service restored to company hit by Medicaid payment processing hack

author: WCAX News Team
title: Service restored to company hit by Medicaid payment processing hack
text: BURLINGTON, Vt. (WCAX) - Vermonters who were forced to pay out of pocket for care and prescriptions that Medicaid covers are finally seeing some relief. A massive cyberattack on UnitedHealth Group and Change Healthcare, a medical payment processor, knocked out services for three weeks. But United said Thursday that it is finally back online. However, Vermont officials said Wednesday they expect there will still be some lingering issues to work out. Related Stories: Company hit by Medicaid payment processing hack says service will be restored by end of week Vt. pharmacies, customers continue to feel the pain from health care hack Officials work to ensure pharmacies provide prescriptions amid Change Healthcare outage Vt. officials responding to pharmacies, health care providers impacted by national cyberattack Cyberattack stymies thousands of Vermonters trying to get needed medications Hack at large US health care tech company leads to security concerns, billing delays Copyright 2024 WCAX.
